reg.name: Temperature low alarm point
reg.description: 255 mean no alarm and is the default value. This value is read and written degrees Celsius Note that the value stored in this register is the real value not the 100* value used for other registers.

reg.name: Temperature high alarm point
reg.description: 255 mean no alarm and is the default value. This value is read and written degrees Celsius Note that the value stored in this register is the real value not the 100* value used for other registers.

reg.description: 255 mean no alarm and is the default value. Note that the value stored in this register is the real value not the 100* value used for other registers.

reg.name: Humidity high alarm point

reg.name: Temp Event Interval
reg.description: Time in seconds between temperature events. (0 is no temperature event, 30 is default).

reg.name: Dewpoint event interval
reg.description: Time in seconds between dew point event. (0 is no temperature event. Set to 30 by default).

event.name: Temperature measurement
event.description: The temperature is reported as a normalized integer value by this event.

data.name: format
data.description: format is the measurement data coding format described in the VSCP specification Bits 5,6,7 is set to 0x08 - Normalized integer format. Bits 3,4 0x00 - Kelvin, 0x01 – Celsius, 0x02 – Fahrenheit. Bits 1,2,3 is set to 0x00 for sensor 1.

data.name: exponent
data.description: This value is always 2 meaning two decimals.

event.name: Humidity measurement
event.description: The humidity is reported as a normalized integer value by this event. Humidity is always reported in percent (0-100%).

data.name: exponent
data.description: This value is always 2 meaning two decimals.

event.name: Dew-point measurement
event.description: The dew-point is reported as a normalized integer value by this event.

data.name: format
data.description: format is the measurement data coding format described in the VSCP specification Bits 5,6,7 is set to 0x08 - Normalized integer format. Bits 3,4 0x00 - Kelvin, 0x01 – Celsius, 0x02 – Fahrenheit. Bits 1,2,3 is set to 0x00 for sensor 1.

data.name: exponent
data.description: This value is always 2 meaning two decimals.

data.name: Alarm type
data.description: A code that tells which alarm type that occured.

item.name: Temperature over limit
item.description: Temperature is above the set high alarm trigger point.

item.name: Temperature under limit
item.description: Temperature is under the set low alarm trigger point.

item.name: Humidity over limit
item.description: Humidity is over the set high alarm trigger point.

item.name: Humidity under limit
item.description: Humidity is under the set low alarm trigger point.

data.name: Alarm register
data.description: Current content of module alarm register.
